```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Year of birth"
```



# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `ybirth`
* Variable label: `Year of birth`
* Variable description: `Year of birth`
* Domain: `Socio-demographic and economic characteristics`
* Value type: `continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


# Data process

## HRS

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description


| **Name** | `RABYEAR` |
|----------|------------|
| **Label** | `R birth year` |
| **Table name** | `HRS-HRS-w1` |
| **Description** |  |






```{r assign_hrs1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1',
                         variables=list('RABYEAR'), missings = TRUE)
HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth')
```

```{r local_hrs1, echo=F}
vari <- HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth$RABYEAR
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth, aes(RABYEAR)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Year of birth") + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_hrs1}
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w1_ybirth$RABYEAR, "NA=999")
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth <- labelled(HRS_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```


#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_hrs1, echo=F}
vari <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HRS_ds_hrs_w1, aes(ybirth)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Year of birth") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(1912, 1981 )
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_hrs1, echo=F}
```





```{r importOPAL_hrs1, echo=F}

#opal.assign.data(o, 'HRS_ds_hrs_w1', HRS_ds_hrs_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'HRS_ds_hrs_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
ybirth <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
save(ybirth, file = "../RData/hrs_w1/ybirth.RData")
rm(ybirth)

HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1 <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth <- car::recode(HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1$ybirth, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
#opal.assign.data(o, 'HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1', HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'HRS_m_ds_hrs_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_mbb10}
HRS_ds_mbb_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_mbb_w10_ybirth$id)
HRS_ds_mbb_w10$ybirth <- car::recode(HRS_mbb_w10_ybirth$RABYEAR, "NA=999")
HRS_ds_mbb_w10$ybirth <- labelled(HRS_ds_mbb_w10$ybirth, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```
